[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.1 Purpose: The Library & Banking System (LBS) defines requirements for cataloging, digital access, reservations, overdue tracking, inter-library loans, and financial reporting.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.2 Scope: LBS enables librarians to manage records, while members handle loans and reservations.

[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.1 System Interfaces: LBS integrates with digital libraries, loan networks, and financial platforms.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.2 User Interfaces: LBS provides a web and mobile UI for librarians and members.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.3 Hardware Interfaces: LBS supports kiosks, desktops, tablets, and smartphones.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.4 Software Interfaces: LBS uses REST APIs, authentication, and cloud storage.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.5 Communications Interfa: LBS supports notifications, messaging, and updates.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.6 Memory Constraints: LBS optimizes storage for records and transactions.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.7 Operations: LBS supports cataloging, reservations, digital access, and overdue tracking.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.8 Site Adaptation Requir: LBS customizes recommendations based on user history.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.9 Interfaces with Servic: LBS connects with loan services, digital providers, and financial systems.

[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.4 Product Functions: LBS supports cataloging, reservations, loans, and financial management.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.5 User Characteristics: LBS serves librarians, members, and financial administrators.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.6 Limitations: LBS requires internet access for digital resources and inter-library loans.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.7 Assumptions and Dependencie: LBS relies on external digital libraries, accounting platforms, and authentication.
[SUBSEC] 1.8 Definitions: Inter-library Loan: Borrowing from partner libraries.

[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-001: The system shall allow librarians to catalog books and manage classification.
[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-002: The system shall allow members to search, borrow, and access digital resources.
[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-003: The system shall integrate with financial platforms for reporting.

[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-001: The system shall allow librarians to catalog books, track overdue materials, notify borrowers, and manage fines (REQ-INTF-001, REQ-DB-001).
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-002: The system shall enable members to browse, borrow, reserve digital and physical resources, and request inter-library loans (REQ-INTF-002, REQ-DB-001).
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-003: The system shall allow librarians to manage events, track attendance, notify participants, and generate financial reports (REQ-INTF-003, REQ-DB-001).

[SUBSEC] 2.3 Usability Requirements.REQ-USAB-001: The system shall provide an intuitive UI for cataloging, reservations, and financial management.

[SUBSEC] 2.4 Performance Requirements.REQ-PERF-001: The system shall process transactions within 2 seconds.

[SUBSEC] 2.5 Logical Database Requiremen.REQ-DB-001: The system shall store catalog records, loan history, reservations, and financial data.

[SUBSEC] 2.6 Design Constraints.REQ-DSGN-001: The system shall support adaptive search and recommendations.

[SUBSEC] 2.7 Standards Compliance.REQ-COMP-001: The system shall comply with data privacy and financial reporting laws.

[SUBSEC] 2.8 Software System Attributes.REQ-ATTR-001: The system shall ensure encrypted data storage and secure authentication.

[SEC] 3. Verification: Tests validate cataloging, access, reservations, overdue tracking, and financial exports.
[SEC] 4. Supporting Information: User guides, API documentation, and compliance guidelines.
[SEC] 5. References: Library standards, financial reports, and digital resource policies.
